## Why this class?

* Most say requirements.
* Interest in ML/Stat learning
* Expressions of love/affection for Stats/CS/ML
* Enjoyment of past similar classes

## Matrix inversion


::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(MASS)
X <- matrix(c(5, 3, 1, -1), nrow = 2)
X
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
     [,1] [,2]
[1,]    5    1
[2,]    3   -1
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
solve(X)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
      [,1]   [,2]
[1,] 0.125  0.125
[2,] 0.375 -0.625
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
ginv(X)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
      [,1]   [,2]
[1,] 0.125  0.125
[2,] 0.375 -0.625
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
X^(-1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
          [,1] [,2]
[1,] 0.2000000    1
[2,] 0.3333333   -1
```
:::
:::




## Linear models


::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
y <- X %*% c(2, -1) + rnorm(2)
coefficients(lm(y ~ X))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
(Intercept)          X1          X2 
  4.8953718   0.9380314          NA 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
coef(lm(y ~ X))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
(Intercept)          X1          X2 
  4.8953718   0.9380314          NA 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
solve(t(X) %*% X) %*% t(X) %*% y
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
          [,1]
[1,]  2.161874
[2,] -1.223843
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
solve(crossprod(X), crossprod(X, y))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
          [,1]
[1,]  2.161874
[2,] -1.223843
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
X \ y # this is Matlab
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-error}
```
Error: <text>:1:3: unexpected '\\'
1: X \
      ^
```
:::
:::

## Grade predictions


::: {.cell layout-align="center"}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](00-quiz-0-wrap_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-7-1.svg){fig-align='center'}
:::
:::


* 4 people say 100%
* 24 say 90%
* 25 say 85%
* 27 say 80%
* Lots of clumping


. . .

1 said 35, and 1 said 50. Woof!

## Prediction accuracy (last year)


::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
summary(lm(actual ~ predicted - 1, data = acc))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
lm(formula = actual ~ predicted - 1, data = acc)

Residuals:
    Min      1Q  Median      3Q     Max 
-63.931  -2.931   1.916   6.052  21.217 

Coefficients:
          Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
predicted  0.96590    0.01025   94.23   <2e-16 ***
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

Residual standard error: 10.2 on 137 degrees of freedom
  (8 observations deleted due to missingness)
Multiple R-squared:  0.9848,	Adjusted R-squared:  0.9847 
F-statistic:  8880 on 1 and 137 DF,  p-value: < 2.2e-16
```
:::
:::

include-after-body:
<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
